actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to amend title 39, United States Code, to provide that the President shall appoint the Postmaster General of the United States, subject to confirmation by the Senate.

summary.text: Provides that the President shall appoint the Postmaster General of the United States, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate. Gives the President the power to remove the Postmaster General upon consultation with the Board of Governors of the Postal Service.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 39, United States Code, to provide that the President shall appoint the Postmaster General of the United States, subject to confirmation by the Senate.
